Name: Box with Rounded Lid
Description: This painted white box was the third in a group of five discovered in the section of the tomb of Tutankhamun called the Treasury. The battens, or strips of wood, that support the base of the box were shaped to fill in between the front and the back legs. They give the appearance to the outer surface of quadrant molding, similar to a quarter circle. The box contained a stone, an anklet, a pair of slippers, and the lid of a small jewelry box.
